title: Radicalism, conflict and society in Asia
abstractText: Crisis Group’s project ‘Radicalism, Conflict and Society in Asia’ comprises a series of studies examining key areas which are closely linked to radicalisation or to policy responses to extremism in Central, South and South East Asia. The aim of Crisis Group’s work is to provide policy-makers, academics and other interested parties with timely analysis and policy recommendations based on research carried out by a network of experts based permanently in or near areas of conflict. The organisation will develop an effective series of papers examining issues including Radicalisation and Migration in Central Asia; Policing and Prisons as Incubators of Extremism in Central Asia; Women and Radical Islam; Taliban Propaganda and Communication Strategies; Extremism and the Judiciary in Pakistan; The Spread of Extremism in and from Pakistan’s Federally Administered Tribal Areas; Sectarianism in Pakistan; Policing in Pakistan; Politics, Radicalisation and Security in Bangladesh; Policing in Bangladesh; Jihadist Networks in Indonesia; Insurgents in Southern Thailand; and Education and Politics in Southern Thailand. Papers will be published on an ongoing basis during the project period and can be accessed via the organisation’s website www.crisisgroup.org.
